thread.title: Open house on $4.2 million turn lane project at Pacific and Quince scheduled
thread.title_full: Open house on $4.2 million turn lane project at Pacific and Quince scheduled | OregonLive.com

author: Dillon Pilorget | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Open house on $4.2 million turn lane project at Pacific and Quince scheduled
text:
An open house on an upcoming roadwork project at the Pacific Avenue and Quince Street intersection in Forest Grove is scheduled for Nov. 5.
Between 5 p.m. and 7 p.m. that day, officials from the city of Forest Grove and the Oregon Department of Transportation will be on hand at the city's Community Auditorium, 1915 Main St., to answer questions and hear feedback on the project plan.
The project, budgeted at $4.2 million, aims to eradicate long lines of traffic that tend to back up on southbound Quince Street and westbound Pacific Avenue, sometimes seeing drivers sit through multiple light cycles before making it through.
The intersection gets considerable commuter traffic as a waypoint on the path to and from U.S. 26, and both streets are state highways.
Plans for the project involve widening Quince Street and Pacific Avenue on the north and east sides of the intersection, respectively. Quince would get a dedicated right-turn lane, and the existing right-turn lane on Pacific Avenue would grow to better accommodate trucks' wide turns. Both lane expansions would also add bike lanes.
Currently, the intersection has dedicated left- and right-turn lanes on the south and west sides.
Other aspects of the project include bringing sidewalks and ramps up to code in accordance with the federal Americans with Disabilities Act. Crews also plan to build a raised median on the east side of the intersection to stop westbound drivers on Pacific Avenue from making left turns into driveways.
The areas in purple in the above map represent the lane expansion project planned for the Forest Grove intersection of Pacific Avenue (Oregon 8) and Quince Street (Oregon 47). Oregon Department of Transportation -- Dillon Pilorget
